result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Branch 13

Court reporte Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jennifer Amelia Cunha.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State motions the court to find counts 1-6 transactionally related. Defense does not object. Court finds counts 1-6 transactionally related. Law enforcement is duly sworn and testifies. Direct by State. Venue established. DE identified. Cross by Atty Cunha. State moves for bind over, reserves argument. Defense objects to bind over; waives argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over to branch 13. ARGN TO BE DONE IN THE BRANCH

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jennifer Amelia Cunha.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court takes up both motions to dismiss filed by the defense. Atty Cunha gives argument. State gives argument. Court makes findings and denies both motions to dismiss filed by the defense.

Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $100,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. THE DEFENDANT SHALL BE FITTED WITH A GPS BY PRE-TRIAL SERVICES PRIOR TO RELEASE FROM CUSTODY. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CAR or any immediate family member of CAR (BAR, BSS, ASR). 
- Defendant shall provide the court with his address and be confined to this address except for medical appointments, court hearings and meeting with counsel.
- Defendant shall not be on Meadow Ln in DeForest. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)] including knives and pepper spray. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

01:33 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jennifer Amelia Cunha.  William Leroy Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
